Is your opinion of Hillary Clinton favorable, unfavorable, or haven't you heard enough about her?

I am going to read you a short list of individuals and for each, please tell me if your opinion of them is generally favorable or generally unfavorable. column1: ABC News/Washington Post Poll. Oct. 15-18, 2015. N=1,001 adults nationwide. Margin of error ± 3.5.
Do you approve or disapprove of the way Hillary Clinton is handling questions about her use of personal email while she was secretary of state?
NBC News/Wall Street Journal Poll conducted by Hart Research Associates (D) and Public Opinion Strategies (R). Oct. 15-18, 2015. N=1,000 adults nationwide. Margin of error ± 3.1.

Based on what you have seen, read, or heard from Hillary Clinton regarding the terrorist attack a few years ago on a U.S. diplomatic outpost in Benghazi, Libya, are you basically satisfied or not satisfied with her response? If you do not know enough about this issue to have an opinion, please just say so and we'll move on.
Monmouth University Poll. Oct. 15-18, 2013. N=1,012 adults nationwide. Margin of error ± 3.1.

Please tell me if your general impression of each of the following is favorable or unfavorable, or if you don't really have an opinion. Former secretary of state Hillary Clinton. N=836 registered voters
CNN/ORC Poll. Oct. 14-17, 2015. N=1,028 adults nationwide. Margin of error ± 3.

As you may know, in 2012, terrorists attacked the U.S. consulate in a town in Libya named Benghazi and killed the U.S. ambassador to that country and three other U.S. citizens. Thinking specifically about Hillary Clinton, who was secretary of state at the time of the attack in Benghazi, are you satisfied or dissatisfied with the way Clinton has handled this matter?
CBS News Poll. Oct. 4-8, 2015. N=1,038 registered voters nationwide, including 343 Democratic primary voters (margin of error ± 6).

We'd like to get your opinion of some public figures. For each of the following people, please say whether your opinion is favorable, not favorable, undecided, or whether you haven't heard enough about him or her yet to have an opinion. Hillary Clinton.
Monmouth University Poll. Aug. 31-Sept. 2, 2015. N=339 registered voters nationwide who are Democrats or lean Democratic. Margin of error ± 5.3.

I'm going to read you a few names of people who are running or might run for president in 2016. Please tell me if your general impression of each is favorable or unfavorable, or if you don't really have an opinion. ... Former secretary of state Hillary Clinton.

Looking back, do you approve or disapprove of the job Hillary Clinton did as secretary of state?

Do you think it would be a good thing or a bad thing for the Democratic Party if Hillary Clinton faced serious competition for the presidential nomination? N=687 Democrats and independents
Gallup Poll. April 3-4, 2015. N=1,023 adults nationwide. Margin of error ± 4.
Who would you like to see the Democrats nominate for president in 2016: Hillary Clinton or someone else? N=462 Democrats and Democratic-leaning independents
ABC News/Washington Post Poll. March 26-29, 2015. N=1,003 adults nationwide. Margin of error ± 3.5.
Thinking about possible presidential candidates, do you have a favorable or unfavorable impression of Hillary Clinton?
CBS News Poll. March 21-24, 2015. N=1,023 adults nationwide. Margin of error ± 3.
How much do you think Hillary Clinton cares about the needs and problems of people like yourself: a lot, some, not much, or not at all?
CNN/ORC Poll. March 13-15, 2015. N=1,009 adults nationwide. Margin of error ± 3.
Thinking about the following characteristics and qualities, please say whether you think it applies or doesn't apply to Hillary Clinton. ... Someone you would be proud to have as president.
CNN/ORC Poll. July 18-20, 2014. N=1,012 adults nationwide. Margin of error ± 3.
Thinking about the following characteristics and qualities, please say whether you think it applies or doesn't apply to Hillary Clinton. ... Is a strong and decisive leader.
CNN/ORC Poll. May 29-June 1, 2014. N=1,003 adults nationwide. Margin of error ± 3.
If Hillary Clinton decides to run for president, do you think it is very likely, somewhat likely, somewhat unlikely or very unlikely that she would win the Democratic nomination in 2016?
ABC News/Washington Post Poll. May 29-June 1, 2014. N=1,002 adults nationwide. Margin of error ± 3.5.
Do you approve or disapprove of the way Hillary Clinton handled her job as secretary of state?
